/registry/audio/sigil_tones.json                # already in repo (used) 2) Godot scene prefab — fusion_field.tscn

Create file: /apps/cathedral_world/scenes/fusion_field.tscn [gd_scene load_steps=3 format=3 uid="!fusionfield"]
[ext_resource path="res://materials/fusion_kink.tres" type="ShaderMaterial" id=1]
[node name="FusionField" type="Node3D"]
script = ExtResource( 2 ) # assigned at runtime by GDExtension registration
transform = Transform3D( 1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0 )

[node name="Plate" type="MeshInstance3D" parent="."]
mesh = null
material_override = ExtResource( 1 )
translate = Vector3(0, 0.5, 0)
scale = Vector3(1.2,1.2,1.2)

[node name="Light" type="OmniLight3D" parent="."]
light_energy = 1.2
light_color = Color(0.6,0.4,0.9)
translate = Vector3(0,1.6, -0.5)

[node name="Particles" type="GPUParticles3D" parent="."]
process_material = ExtResource( 3 ) # set later with daimon.trail.tres
amount = 200
emitting = true

[node name="RitualHUD" parent="." instance=ExtResource(4)] Notes:
	•	script will be linked at runtime by godot-rust when you register FusionKinkLive.
	•	Mesh: replace with a plane/sigil mesh in Godot editor; or supply a sigil_plate.glb and set Plate.mesh = load("res://models/sigil_plate.glb").
	•	Particles.process_material points to daimon.trail.tres (see particle file below).
	•	RitualHUD is included as an instance (create the HUD scene below and save as RitualHUD.tscn and then reference here).
